title: Too many chain reorgs happenning too frequently in a proof of authority (clique) based private blockchain.
body:
I'm studying on Proof of Authority (Clique) based blockchains. I've setup private networks with 1 validator nodes few times, things really go well in 1 validator but when I add 2 / 3 validators in the network via clique.propose, lots of reorgs starts to happen. Sometime, reorg happens even 2-3 times every minute. Currently, I have a 3 validator based network with a block time of 5 seconds (tried longer block time such as 10sec and reorg still happens) and my geth version is 1.10.11.

It would be a great help for me if anyone can point me what can be the reason behind this reorgs and how to prevent it.

**Commands used to run validator:**

`geth --datadir ./data --networkid 333 --port 10100 --bootnodes 'enode://ip_v4:10100' --maxpeers 10 --syncmode full --allow-insecure-unlock -unlock 0 --password ./keys/pwd.txt --mine --miner.gaslimit 210000000`

```
INFO [10-29|12:01:06.078] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=0 mgas=0.000 elapsed="363.701Âµs" mgasps=0.000 number=56077 hash=6bda56..c0220a dirty=0.00B

```
They both import block `56077`/`6bda56` around the same time. And it looks like _none_ of them were the sealer behind it. All of them have peercount `4`. Are you sure there's not another node in there, which also mines with the same key as one of the others? 

EDIT: Actually, on the three logs you provided, 1 and 2 are the same.

No, there are no other miners. I've set up other read-only nodes without any mining option, so peercount is more than 3.

And yeah, logs from 1 and 2 looks the same, but they are from different nodes. Btw what more information do I need to provide?

Not sure what's wrong, maybe epoch? I added 2 nodes one by one after epoch time was over (have 25k blocks gap between adding new validators since my epoch config is 25000). After adding 2nd node there was no reorgs for a day, reorg started happening right after I added the 3rd node.

**Command used to add new validator:**
`clique.propose("0xaaa...", true)`

I used this command on the 1st node and then after it mined a block I run this same command on the 2nd node. Then the 3rd node started mining and reorg started popping up every 20-30 seconds.

According to my calculation, reorg rate was 10% to 15%, so in every 100 blocks 10 to 15 times reorg was happening. This rate is extremely high for a closed system where no public nodes or miner can connect.
If we see the log, we can find reorgs in 27, 31, 55, 61, 79, 106, 127, 151, 193, 253, 259, 268 â†’ 12 times in 22 minutes. This is extremely high.
I think this is to be expected on a clique network.
